eu.smartcampus.api

Interface DeviceConnectivityAPI


  • public interface DeviceConnectivityAPI
    API that abstracts the connection details to devices.

    Timestamps are local to datapoints.

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes

    • Method Detail

      • getAllDatapoints

        DatapointAddress[] getAllDatapoints()
        Gets all sensors register in the system.
        Returns:
        the list of all registered sensors

      • getDatapointMetadata

        Metadata getDatapointMetadata(DatapointAddress address)
        For each datapoint of a given sensor gets their metadata.
        Parameters:
        address - the set of datapoints, belonging to the sensor, for which we want to know the metadata
        Returns:
        the metadata for each datapoint

      • requestDatapointRead

        int requestDatapointRead(DatapointAddress address,
                       int clientKey)
        Gets the last available reading of a datapoint.

        It is expected that implementations of this method force a reading to the specified datapoint. However, when the reading cannot be forced on the device, it is expected that the last available reading from the device (that could have been cached) is returned.

        Parameters:
        address - the absolute address of the datapoint to be read
        clientKey - the identifier of the client making the request * @return the id of the write request used to by the client to identify the acknowledge of this request
        Returns:
        the id of the write request used to by the client to identify the acknowledge of this request

      • requestDatapointWindowRead

        int requestDatapointWindowRead(DatapointAddress address,
                             java.security.Timestamp start,
                             java.security.Timestamp finish,
                             int clientKey)
        Gets the readings a datapoint within a given time window.

        Implementations of this method may query the meter or return cached values. Since meters are devices with limited resources, specifying start to far into the past may result in only a subset of the values.

        Parameters:
        address - the absolute address of the datapoint to be read
        start - the timestamp that defines the initial window
        finish - timestamp that defines the final window. Should be greater or equal to start.
        clientKey - the identifier of the client making the request
        Returns:
        the id of the read request used to by the client to identify the acknowledge of this request

      • requestDatapointWrite

        int requestDatapointWrite(DatapointAddress address,
                        Value value,
                        int clientKey)
        Request a datapoint write.
        Parameters:
        address - the address of the datapoint
        value - the value to be written to the datapoint
        clientKey - the identifier of the client making the request
        Returns:
        the id of the write request used to by the client to identify the acknowledge of this request

        a client key
